00001 /*
00002 **  DTSPSOCK.H -- Structures and constants for parallel socket transfers.
00003 **
00004 */
00005 
00006 #define SERVADDR    "127.0.0.1"     /* default server address   */
00007 
00008 #define DEF_XFER_PORT   3001            /* default transport socket */
00009 #define DEF_MAX_PORTS   64          /* max open transport sockets   */
00010 #define DEF_NTHREADS    10      /* default threads to create    */
00011 #define MAX_THREADS 512     /* max transfer threads to run  */
00012 #define MAXTRIES    128     /* max times to resend      */
00013 
00014 #define DO_CHECKSUMS    0       /* debug flags          */
00015 
00016 #define PS_SOURCE   0       /* data source          */
00017 #define PS_DEST     1       /* data sink            */
00018 
00019 #define PS_PUSH     XFER_PUSH   /* push transfer model      */
00020 #define PS_PULL     XFER_PULL   /* pull transfer model      */
00021 
00022 
00023 #define SZ_XFER_BUFFER  (1024 * 1025 * 4) /* transfer buffer size   */
00024 
00025 #define TCP_WINDOW_MAX  196608      /* TCP window max size      */
00026 #define TCP_WINDOW_SZ   262144
00027 #define SZ_XFER_CHUNK   (1024 *  1024 * 2)

00030 
00031 
00032 #ifdef USE_PHDR
00033 /*  Packet header.  A data "stripe" is preceeded by a header packet 
00034 **  containing information about the stripe.  This is also used when
00035 **  doing checksums after transferring each stripe.
00036 */
00037 typedef struct {
00038     unsigned short  sum16;      /* 16-bit checksum      */
00039     unsigned int    sum32;      /* 32-bit checksum      */
00040     int         chunkSize;      /* transfer 'chunk' size    */
00041     long        offset;     /* file offset of stripe    */
00042     long        maxbytes;       /* max bytes to transfer    */
00043 } phdr, *phdrP;
00044 
00045     
00046 /*  Data structure used to pass information into parallel socket worker
00047 **  thread.
00048 */
00049 typedef struct {
00050     char     fname[256];        /* file name            */
00051     char     dir[256];          /* working directory        */
00052     long     fsize;         /* file size            */
00053 
00054     char     host[256];         /* remote host name     */
00055     int      port;          /* remote port number       */
00056     int      mode;          /* push or pull mode        */
00057 
00058     int      tnum;          /* processing thread number */
00059     long     nbytes;            /* number of bytes to transfer  */
00060     long     start;         /* start byte number        */
00061     long     end;           /* ending byte number       */
00062 } psArg, *psArgP;
00063 #endif
00064

00067 pthread_mutex_t svc_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;

00071                         long fsize, int mode, int rate, int port, char *host,
00072                         int verbose, pthread_t *tids);
00073 int    *udtCollectThreads (int nthreads, pthread_t *tids);

00076 void    udtSendFile (void *data);
00077 void    udtReceiveFile (void *data);

00080             long *chsize, long *start, long *end);

00083             long maxbytes);
00084 unsigned char *udtReceiveStripe (int s, long offset, int tnum);
